item.title: The Real Book and the Materiality of Musical Practice
item.description: Groovin’ High analyzes a copy of the Real Book, as a non-sonic component of the practice of music. The Real Book, originally compiled by two students at the Berklee School of Music in the 1970s, is a compilation of lead sheets of popular songs that specify the basic elements of a composition: melody, lyrics, chord changes and structure. The Real Book was created as an update of the fake books, which were widely used by U.
